Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that there is no test kit for COVID-19, when in reality there was a test kit available, although its rollout was problematic.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not acknowledging the existence of a test kit, even though it acknowledges that there were confusing and contradictory statements about the availability of tests.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support by not providing evidence or sources to back up the statement that there is no test kit for COVID-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the lack of a test kit is a result of incompetence or negligence, without considering other factors that may have contributed to the issues with the rollout of test kits.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the availability of test kits, such as the challenges in developing and distributing a new test for a novel virus in a short period of time.
